articles.author: Massachusetts Institute of Technology
articles.title: Biologists discover a new type of control over RNA splicing - Phys.org
articles.description: RNA splicing is a cellular process that is critical for gene expression. After genes are copied from DNA into messenger RNA, portions of the RNA that don't code for proteins, called introns, are cut out and the coding portions are spliced back together.
